posts._title: Paul Bogart / Arthur Miller – Great Performances: A Memory of Two Mondays (1971)
posts.title: Great Performances: A Memory of Two Mondays
posts.excerpt: Set in the summer of 1933,in the depths of the Great Depression, Arthur Miller’s one-act play “A Memory of Two Mondays” (1955) focuses on the workers in a Brooklyn automobile parts warehouse, a grim place in which men and women work for small wages and are grateful for the work. posts.title: Johnny Tremain
posts.excerpt: Plot: In colonial Boston, a young silversmith’s apprentice injures his hand, and finds himself befriended by the Sons of Liberty and caught up in events of the American Revolution.

posts.title: Zelary
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:A nurse and her surgeon-lover are part of a resistance movement in 1940s Czechoslovakia. When they are discovered, her lover flees and she must find a place to hide. A patient whose life she saved, a man from a remote mountain village where time stopped 150 years ago, agrees to hide her as his wife.

posts.title: Honeyland (2019)
posts.excerpt: STORYLINE:The last female beehunter in Europe must save the bees and return the natural balance in Honeyland, when a family of nomadic beekeepers invade her land and threaten her livelihood. This film which is filmed in Macedonia is an exploration of an observational Indigenous visual narrative that deeply impacts our behavior towards natural resources and …

posts.title: Les inconnus dans la maison
posts.excerpt: From frenchfilms.org Georges Simenon’s 1940 novel Les Inconnus dans la maison is a brooding study in social breakdown and youth disaffection that contains a powerful critique of western society of the 1940s.
